title: What are the philosophical differences between a philosopher and a person with other studies? - Quora

response.answer_text: A small and short answer: Someone more interested in the deeper assumptions of the studies/disciplines than those who are studying/researching directly the sciences, math, humanities, social sciences, and arts themselves. Human experience has many sides, the study of them has multiple distinct disciplines as a result, and philosophy ranges over all of them — deep down.
